text.question:

Options:
150 mCi
38 mCi
19 mCi
9.4 mCi
text.subject: college_chemistry

text.question:
Which one sentence explains most accurately why spin trapping is often used to detect free radical intermediates?

Options:
spin trapping provides more structural information than direct detection by EPR
spin trapping makes it easy to quantify free radical intermediates
steady state concentration of free radical intermediates is often too low to enable direct detection by EPR
detection of spin adducts requires lower power than direct detection of radical intermediates
text.answer: detection of spin adducts requires lower power than direct detection of radical intermediates
text.subject: college_chemistry

text.question:
Which of the following describes the fallacy of appeal to loyalty?

Options:
arguing that someone should do something because it will make him or her better liked by others
responding to an argument with an expression of derision
arguing that an idea should be accepted only because of who originated the idea
arguing that someone should do something to be loyal to a person or a group
text.answer: arguing that someone should do something to be loyal to a person or a group
text.subject: logical_fallacies
